data.title: Effective Physics Titles
data.text:
*Cost/Impact Factor has been used as one way of measuring the cost-effectiveness of journals. It relates the cost of a journal to its impact as measured by its citation record. It is derived by dividing the Cost per 1000 Characters by the ISI Impact Factor. Here is an example for the Reviews of Modern Physics.

Cost per 1000 characters = 4.0 cents.

ISI Impact Factor = 20.208

4.0/20.208 = 0.198

Cost/Impact Factor = 0.198
